name: HTML
opinion: We should all know HTML, it's logical. It's the skeleton of the web, without it there's nothing. Don't be fools denigrating HTML just for being a markup language, it's the most important language of the web.

name: CSS
opinion: Same as above, personally I hate using pure CSS, my brain ends up exploding in spaghetti, but it's necessary to know it to understand how CSS frameworks work.

name: JavaScript
opinion: Personally, I HATE JavaScript, it's a chaotic language with horrible syntax and unpredictable behavior. However, it is the most widely used programming language in the world, and it is essential for web development. I use it when I have no other option, but I always prefer to use TypeScript.

name: Typescript
opinion: Strongly typed superset of JavaScript. I use it for large projects for safety and maintainability. Bro, I hate JavaScript.

name: Python
opinion: Versatile and powerful. Ideal for backend, data analysis, and automation. The best for every day, I use it for everything, from scripts to web applications.

name: PHP
opinion: Vanilla PHP is chaos, but with Laravel it's a pleasure. I use it for web development, especially with Laravel.

name: React
opinion: I love it! Total DIY. Modern framework for dynamic interfaces.

name: Vue.js
opinion: Very easy for beginners and integrable. I also like it.

name: Angular
opinion: I don't like it. I only used it briefly and didn't enjoy the experience.

name: Tailwind CSS
opinion: Excellent, customizable, and fast for UI. Main CSS framework in all my projects.

name: Bootstrap
opinion: Not bad, only for serious and lightweight projects, but I prefer Tailwind CSS.

name: Foundation
opinion: Classic style, few components, but I like it for simple desktop web apps.

name: FontAwesome
opinion: Great for icons, easy to use and widely supported. Main icon library.

name: Axios
opinion: Simple and effective for HTTP requests. I use it for APIs in frontend. Fetch is mid.

name: Chart.js
opinion: Powerful and flexible for interactive charts. I use it for data visualization.

name: Flask
opinion: Lightweight and flexible. Perfect for small/medium Python projects. This site is made with Flask.

name: Laravel
opinion: I love it! Elegant, my main framework for EVERYTHING. Go-to for PHP and all projects.

name: Eloquent
opinion: Elegant and powerful. Ideal for databases in Laravel.

name: SQLAlchemy
opinion: Powerful and flexible. I use it for databases in Flask.

name: MySQL / MariaDB
opinion: Reliable and widely used. Ideal for structured data and complex queries.

name: PostgreSQL
opinion: Advanced and powerful database.

name: Oracle
opinion: I only used it at university. It's fine, but the cost is not worth it. Academic experience.

name: MongoDB
opinion: Flexible and scalable. Perfect for unstructured data and rapid development.

name: Redis
opinion: Fast and efficient. I use it for cache and real-time apps.

name: Docker
opinion: Double-edged sword: if it works, great; if not, you're screwed. But I love it anyway.

name: Docker Compose
opinion: Great for managing multiple containers. I orchestrate all my services with it.

name: Jenkins
opinion: Highly customizable and used to automate builds and deployments. I use it for CI/CD pipelines.

name: GitHub Actions
opinion: Automation of builds and deployments directly from GitHub.

name: Bash Scripts
opinion: I prefer to write my own scripts to automate tasks. I don't like to depend on third-party tools.

name: cPanel
opinion: I don't like it, I never use it. I don't like programs that make things too easy.
